Case reference: 2014001381.CaseDesc: On March 24, 1982, Patricia Elizabeth Flynn was last seen running away from her family residence in a densely wooded area near her home in Yarrow, British-Colombia. Patricia was despondent and had medical issues that required attention at the time of her disappearance.

Case reference: 2012020107.CaseDesc: Isabelle Bourgeot, 32, was seen for the last time on November 1st, 1985 in the La Cité-Limoilou district in Quebec City, Quebec. At the time of her disappearance Isabelle wasn’t carrying any identification papers. It should be noted that she suffers from amnesia.

Case reference: 2014005084.CaseDesc: On February 1, 2008, it is suspected the Kevin Leroux went through the ice on his ATV, near St Joseph's Cove, NL. His ATV was recovered several months later, about 22 km from where he was suspected of going through the ice but his body was never found.

Case reference: 2017076047.CaseDesc: On July 1, 2017, an unidentified male body was located on the west bank of the North Saskatchewan River and approximately 300m south of the Dawson Bridge in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014000008.CaseDesc: On February 2, 2008, Christopher Hargitt, a resident of Vernon, BC, drove from Vernon to Vancouver. He was last seen by an associate, who was dropped off by Mr. Hargitt near the PNE Fairgrounds. On March 6, 2008, Christopher's vehicle was found unoccupied in East Vancouver, and he has made no contact with family or friends since that time. It is believed that Christopher may have run afoul of individuals involved in criminal activity, or fled the country to avoid these same persons.

Case reference: 2020008878.CaseDesc: On September 19, 1979, Joseph Vetere was seen for the last time in the area of 1061, Weston Road in Toronto, Ontario.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, A penny with the initials "T.W."
Left Upper Arm, Bear on a rock

Case reference: 2014001590.CaseDesc: On May 1, 1990, Claude L'Heureux was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Claude had worked in bars in The Village district of Montreal, Quebec. No one has seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2014004453.CaseDesc: On January 29, 2004, Samuel Samuelson was seen for the last time while driving a snowmobile by the lake on Bizard Island toward Deux Montagnes in Montreal, Quebec. The ice collapsed and Samuel and his snowmobile fell into the water.

Jewelry: Gold, Chain with razor blade pendant
Gold, Bracelet worn on right wrist

Case reference: 2016068715.CaseDesc: On July 21, 2013, the body of an adult male was found floating in the Niagara River across from the Youngstown Marina, near the Niagara on the Lake yacht club. Anthropological analysis has suggested that he is black, although there are some features which suggest that he may be mixed Black and Caucasian. He is described as obese however this may be due to post-mortem changes. He is thought to have been in the water for at least one year, and possibly a few years.

Case reference: 2006007299.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1985, Byron Simmons and Julie Ann Schneider were observed fishing from a boat in Lake Huron. They were near the Nuclear Power Generation Station, near Inverhuron, Ontario, in the outflow from the nuclear plant. The couple failed to return to their cottage and are presumed drowned.  Their boat was recovered the following spring washed up on shore to the north, near Oliphant, Ontario.

Hair: Grey, White, Other, Short, Afro style

Case reference: 2014003706.CaseDesc: Albert Crow and a friend attempted to cross Harrop Lake, Manitoba in a canoe despite high winds and the rough water. A second party in another canoe was ahead of Mr. Crow's and observed at one point of the crossing that the canoe was no longer visible. Searches were made of the shoreline and dragging operations of the lake were undertaken at the time without success. On October 12, 1974, the body of Mr. Crow's friend was recovered. His cause of death was later determined to be drowning. Albert Crow is presumed also dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2020043711.CaseDesc: Alfred L'Arrivee was last seen on May 3, 1973 at a rural property where he resided in Keg River, Alberta. Alfred has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2006010199.CaseDesc: Mr. Donald Chorney was last seen leaving the Keys Lake Campground near Grassy Narrows, Ontario to go for a boat ride.  He has never returned and is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2013000041.CaseDesc: David Luborksy was reported missing on the 4th of November 2010. Mr. Luborksy was last seen leaving the Parklane Residence which is situated at 1095 Merivale Road, in the City of Ottawa.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Irishman holding a beer
Right Side Of Neck, Clover leaf

Case reference: 1999000026.CaseDesc: On Oct 15, 1997, Jami Furnandiz was last seen in the town of Port Perry, Ontario, after dropping her child off to day care.  She was scheduled to attend school in the area but did not show up and has not been seen since.  Jami Furnandiz frequented the Oshawa downtown and was known to hitchhike by means of traveling between cities.

Tattoo: Left Shoulder, red heart with arrow through it

Case reference: 2014001072.CaseDesc: On July 19 1984, the body of a male believed to be between the ages of 18-29 was found in the waters of the Fraser River near Boston Bar, British Columbia. He had some crowding on his upper teeth and no tattoos or obvious scars. It is believed he was deceased for a few months prior to his remains being recovered.

Case reference: 2006006199.CaseDesc: Donald Douma has been missing since May 19, 1981. Donald was an avid outdoorsman and he occasionally hitchiked. He was last seen leaving home on a blue CCM bicycle. Donald Douma had expressed interest in moving out West and his family believes that is where he may have gone to.

Teeth: Crooked, Some dental work, upper front tooth has had some white fillings.

Case reference: 2014004062.CaseDesc: Steve Langlois left the Gascon's dock at Port Daniel on April 27, 1996 on a lobster fishing boat. The boat was then hit by a wave and capsized. Mr. Langlois has not been found.

Case reference: 2011002599.CaseDesc: On May 29, 1998, Marcus Schmidseder walked away from his family’s home in Mississauga. Marcus’s intended destination is unknown; there was a possible sighting of him in Massey, Ontario on June 9, 1998. He may have been attempting to make his way to the western provinces.

Case reference: 2016000962.CaseDesc: On January 5, 2016, Felix Claveau was last seen when he jumped off the Viau Bridge into the Rivière-des-Prairies in Laval, Quebec. Felix hasn’t been seen since.

Case reference: 2014003388.CaseDesc: Janet Henry was a resident of Vancouver's downtown east side; she struggled with mental health and was engaged in a high risk lifestyle. Despite her challenges, Ms. Henry kept in frequent contact with her family. She was last seen on June 25, 1997, and was reported missing two days later.

Case reference: 2014003363.CaseDesc: At 2:00 a.m. on April 21st, 1992, Hilda BEAUDOIN and her brother left the Beagle Lounge in Mary's Harbour, NL on a single snowmobile to ride across the sea ice near coastal waters in efforts to return to St. Lewis, NL. They did not arrive at their destination. Snowmobile tracks were discovered leading into open water near St. Lewis where the snowmobile and her brother's body were later recovered from the ocean waters.

Case reference: 2017056036.CaseDesc: On July 9, 2017, Jason McGrath was last seen modifying his kayak at the family's cottage in Cape George, Nova Scotia. Jason had indicated that he intended on taking the kayak out onto the water. The kayak and Jason’s other personal belongings were recovered on a shore in Judique, Nova Scotia.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Red circle with flames

Case reference: 2017043661.CaseDesc: In February of 2017, Robert Kovacs was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. He was taken from Canada to Romania by his mother, Kinga Costiniuc.

Case reference: 2012020040.CaseDesc: Jerry Paquette was last seen on the Louis Bull First Nations Reserve on January 1, 1982.

Case reference: 2005006199.CaseDesc: On June 3, 1975, the remains of an unidentified man were found in a wooded area near an unused logging road in the northeast corner of North Bay. Anthropological analysis suggests that he may be Caucasian and has been dead in excess of 1-2 years.

Case reference: 2014002868.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1989, Ronald Jack last spoke with his mother. During that telephone discussion, Ronald had informed her that he and his wife, Doreen Jack, would be leaving for a “camp job”. He had also said that they would be gone for approximately 10 days, and would be back before their sons, Russell and Ryan Jack, started their school year in September.

Case reference: 2014003823.CaseDesc: On June 6, 1996, Patricia Ferguson was seen for the last time in the Pointe-aux-Trembles district of Montreal, Quebec. That night, Patricia had slept at a friend's place but had left the apartment, without her young daughter. She left a note saying she was going out for breakfast, and then meeting her sister. Patricia has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2007005699.CaseDesc: Henry Pegahmagabow was last seen in the area of the Kipling Hotel on August 15, 1962.  His boat was found the next morning in the Parry Sound Harbour.  It is believed that he may have drowned in an attempt to return to Parry Island.

Case reference: 2016052751.CaseDesc: On August 4, 2016, Suchand Reddy Pingli was seen for the last time at his apartment in the Le Plateau-Mont-Royal District of Montreal, Quebec. Suchand suffers from health problems and has to take medication regularly. He is from India.

Case reference: 2006002399.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1995, an unidentified woman was discovered under a cement floor at the former site of Robertson Motors located on 1515 Danforth Avenue in Toronto, Ontario. The cement floor was poured in 1949.

Case reference: 2014004253.CaseDesc: On October 13, 2000, two boats were on the Churchill River headed to Granville Lake. One of the boats began taking on water and experiencing motor problems. Most of the occupants of the disabled boat boarded another boat. Mr. Linklater however stayed on the disabled boat attempting to start it. The missing boat was located the next day, however Mr. Linklater was not aboard. He is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2014001028.CaseDesc: The body of this middle aged man was found in the Fraser River near Quesnel, British Columbia on May 20, 1968. He was well dressed and had custom orthotic supports in his shoes. He would have been born around 1920, had grey hair and likely had full dentures.

Other: Case, Leather case with nail clippers
Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Pen Knife, Pen Knife
Leather, Black, Small key case with 15 keys
Wallet: Brown, Light brown leather wallet with dark brown stitching
Shoes: Leather, Black, Pointed dress shoe with Dr.Scholl's arch support insole

Case reference: 2014007309.CaseDesc: On August 20, 1997, a canoeist found a human skull on the Moose Jaw River, just south of Moose Jaw, SK. The skull was examined by the University Of Saskatchewan Department Of Archaeology. It was determined the skull had been exposed to the elements for 50 to 100 years. It was that of a 12 year old, possibly Caucasian, female. This case is being investigated by the Office of the Chief Coroner and the Royal Canadian Mounted Police.

Case reference: 2020011537.CaseDesc: On February 11, 1985, Veronica Butch was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Veronica had moved out of the apartment that she shared with her boyfriend and she was supposed to move in with her sister, but she never arrived.

Case reference: 2020007648.CaseDesc: James Oshanek was last seen at the end of August 1991 in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001084.CaseDesc: On August 12, 1987, the skeletal remains of a man were found near the Franz Run on Whistler Mountain in British Columbia. He may have been from South Africa or the United States. It is estimated that he may have gone missing a year to three years prior and may have been despondent at the time.

Shoes: Leather, White, Nike, Tennis shoes; size 8

Case reference: 2008023399.CaseDesc: Christine Ziomkiewicz was last seen on June 23, 1978, by co-workers at Queen's University, where she worked as a laboratory technician. Her vehicle was still in the building’s parking lot and there was nothing to indicate she had left intentionally for any period of time. She is not believed to have been in a relationship at the time of her disappearance.

Case reference: 2014006416.CaseDesc: On January 24, 2014, at approximately 10:15 a.m., Richard Hicks was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020007628.CaseDesc: On August 16, 1971, at approximately 8:30pm, Stephanie Rawlinson was last seen near 2801 Jane Street in Toronto, Ontario. Stephanie had left her home in a cab after getting into a disagreement.

Mark: Right Eye, Mole near right eye

Case reference: 2014006349.CaseDesc: Jonathan Riley left his residence on April 26, 2013, indicating he was going to Toronto for a few days. His mode of transportation is unknown as he did not have access to a vehicle.  His family and friends have not heard from him since May 2013.  He is a self-employed computer technician.

Case reference: 2013000089.CaseDesc: Daniel Marceau was last seen on June 7, 1989 in Montréal. He was despondent, and told a friend that he was going up north to reflect on his life.

Case reference: 2014002734.CaseDesc:
Martin Munawych was last seen the day he left a relatives residence near Lac La Biche, AB, he appeared to be happy at the time. 
It is believed that may have been travelling to Edmonton or Calgary. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014004876.CaseDesc: In 1999, Fathiya Mohamed was seen for the last time. Fathiya and her family had emigrated from Somalia to England and to different parts of Canada.

Case reference: 2005001799.CaseDesc: On June 1, 1975, the body of an older adult female was located on the west bank of the Niagara River, in the town of Niagara-on-the-Lake. She is believed to be the same person who was witnessed jumping into the Horseshoe Falls on February 17, 1975. She is thought to be 40 plus years, short and heavy-set, with brown hair. She suffered from lung disease and had severe arthritis of her lumbar spine, which may have been painful. When witnessed going over the Falls, she was wearing a long overcoat, possibly grey, and carrying a green umbrella. There is no confirmation that the jumper and the deceased are the same person, however the general descriptions are in agreement. The condition of her remains suggest that she had been in the water for weeks to months.

Teeth: This female probably had a partial dental plate and still retained a gold crown on her right upper canine tooth.

Case reference: 2014005541.CaseDesc: On September 5, 2010, Shawn Smith was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. On September 6, Shawn arrived in the Dominican Republic and was scheduled to return on the September 12, but never returned home.

Case reference: 2014004476.CaseDesc: Gayebrella King was reported missing by her family on May 8, 1980. She was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta in late August 1978.

Case reference: 2014002244.CaseDesc: On August 11, 2000, Giuseppe Ciancio was seen for the last time at the Beaches Pub in the Saint-Laurent District of Montreal, Quebec. On that evening, Giuseppe left the bar with a friend in a beige Dodge Caravan. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2008020999.CaseDesc: Dave MacDermott was last seen on or about Saturday November 9, 2002 in Kitchener, Ontario. He had been out celebrating a friend’s birthday. It was initially reported that Dave left town with his dog and his 1990 Ford Mustang. However, his vehicle was located parked in a parking lot near his residence and his dog was found wandering the neighbourhood.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Some missing teeth with some decay; he has cracked lower left teeth
Boots: Black, Motorcycle boots with a buckle on each boot
Tattoo: Torso (Back), small ladybug between shoulder blades

Case reference: 2021038782.CaseDesc: On June 17, 2017, at approximately 7:50 p.m., John Shankland was last seen near the Brink of the American Falls in Niagara Falls, New York. During the time of his disappearance, John was despondent.

Shirt: Yellow, TEE SHIRT, T-shirt; “volunteer for MS, New York Chapter 2010”
Scar: Right Forearm, Three-inch scar from cancer surgery

Case reference: 2014003848.CaseDesc: On November 5, 1964, the Grand Rapids RCMP was advised that there were rumors that Harvey Hudson was two weeks over due in returning from a trip to Cedar Lake from Grand Rapids. After numerous inquiries it was discovered M. Hudson left The Pas Manitoba on October 20th and arrived at Cedar Lake Post.  When he reached Cedar Lake, M. Hudson was advised by a friend to wait for a boat from Easterville which was expected shortly. A witness who spoke to M. Hudson indicated that he first left on foot for Easterville but turned back. He then took a canoe and started off for Easterville using a piece of board as a paddle. It is believed that Mr. Hudson had little or no food, no rifle or other camping gear. Numerous land, air and water patrols were made with negative results.

Case reference: 2015050387.CaseDesc: Linda Normandin was last seen leaving a shelter in Longueuil on September 3, 2015. She has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2017023773.CaseDesc: On April 18, 2017 the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Ottawa River near Wendover, Ontario. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this man was either of European ancestry, or Middle Eastern/North African ancestry, or mixed European and Middle Eastern/North ancestry.

Case reference: 2014002539.CaseDesc: On August 28, 1973, Amelie McArthur’s vehicle was found running with the lights on and the driver’s side door open on the Taylor Bridge in Taylor, BC. Amelie was last seen leaving her home in Taylor in that vehicle earlier that morning.

Case reference: 2006025499.CaseDesc: On September 11, 1976, Anthony Malinak and friends arrived at Long Lake and fished during the day. That evening Mr. Malinak had taken a boat from Mountain Lodge on Long Lake. The boat was found at the east end of the lake in a foot of water.  Mr. Malinak's rain jacket and hat were found in the boat. He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2017047772.CaseDesc: On August 15, 2017, Moacir Ferrari was seen for the last time leaving his home with his belongings in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001410.CaseDesc: Emma Dixon was last seen on July 22, 1964 at her home on Union Bar Reserve, in Hope, British Columbia. Her husband said that she may have gone to Washington for work. Emma never told anyone she was leaving and did not take any personal belongings. She was reported missing on August 20, 1964.

Case reference: 2021009119.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2021, Amber Ellis was reported missing by her mother. Amber communicated with her friends and family, including her two children, on a regular basis prior to her disappearance. During the time of her disappearance, Amber was leading a high-risk lifestyle.

Scar: Left Thigh, Scar from a stab wound

Case reference: 2019026482.CaseDesc: Kristofer Couture drove his vehicle from Alberta to the lower mainland in British Columbia to find work and had cut off ties from his family. Kristofer worked construction for a short period of time while living in his vehicle near Maple Ridge, British Columbia. Kristofer also frequented a gym in Burnaby, British Columbia. Kristofer was last seen leaving the Royal Columbian Hospital in New Westminster, British Columbia on January 26, 2019. His unoccupied vehicle was seen the following day parked at the Elk Mountain Trail in Chilliwack, British Columbia. Kristofer was reported missing on May 17, 2019 and his vehicle was found parked at the same location.

Case reference: 2006010799.CaseDesc: On July 23, 1979, Keith Cromwell was last seen as he departed from Quarry Island/Lake of the Woods, near Kenora, Ontario, in a motor boat. Keith never arrived at his destination, Fog Island.

Case reference: 2014002675.CaseDesc: Richard Monroe was last seen on October 2nd, 2001 by the owners of Serge's Restaurant on Elgin Street in the city of Greater Sudbury. Richard is believed to have suffered from dementia. He spent most of his time in Thessalon, Sault Ste. Marie, Dunn's Valley, Sudbury and British Columbia.

Case reference: 1999000140.CaseDesc: On April 3, 1993, Mary Nancy Goodfellow left home in the company of her grandson Kevin James Charles. Nothing has been heard from them since.

Scar: Forehead, scar on right side of forehead

Case reference: 2012020082.CaseDesc: Katelyn Noble was last seen in the Radisson, SK district in mid August, 2007. Katelyn has had no contact with her family or friends in Mission, BC, and her whereabouts are unknown.

Case reference: 2014003825.CaseDesc: Ruby Ann Hardy was reported missing by her brother in 2002. She was last seen in the downtown east side of Vancouver in June 1997, and was engaged in a high risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2012020067.CaseDesc: At the time of her disappearance she was a ward of Brandon Mental health Centre and it is believed that she walked out of the facility on her own the day of her disappearance.  She may have had a tattoo on her forearm.

Jacket: Cream, Ivory, With green and brown

Case reference: 2014004467.CaseDesc: On November 16, 1997, Sadhi, Samia, Samir, and Saeed Jiredeh were last seen as they left their home with their father in Toronto, Ontario. That day, their parents had gotten into an argument prior to them leaving.

Case reference: 2016061831.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1980, a caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 50 to 65 years old, was found at the bottom of the fourth floor stairway of the parking garage at 50 Cumberland Avenue in Yorkville, Toronto. He had trauma to his face and skull possibly due to a fall down the stairs. His appendix was present and he was circumcised.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Short, Beard of a couple of days
Teeth: Visible Missing, Many of his teeth were lost some time before death and some of the remaining teeth had cavities. He had no dental work.
Shirt: Yellow, Long sleeved sport shirt with "Stevenson 114" written on the inside of the collar
Shorts: Light Blue, Dark Blue, Checkered, size 30 from Sears
Pants: Brown, Blue, Light brown, plaid, Levi's brand

Case reference: 2017065923.CaseDesc: Oleg Chmelev was last seen at his home in the area of Morning Star Drive and Brandon Gate Drive, Mississauga, on October 30, 2017. His green bicycle was also missing and was his main mode of transportation.

Case reference: 2014005313.CaseDesc: On September 24, 2007, Azelea Brown last spoke to her mother who was overseas.

Case reference: 2014004860.CaseDesc: Lesley Holmes was reported missing by her common law husband on December 23, 2005 after not having contact with her since November 23, 2005.  They had been living in a basement apartment in Toronto, the home of a friend. Lesley did not feel comfortable staying there without her common law who was away, so she moved out. She was believed to have spent some time in a shelter but this could not be confirmed by the shelter.  Her family has not seen or heard from her since that time.

Case reference: 2016070209.CaseDesc: On April 11, 2003, the body of a woman was recovered from the bank of the North Saskatchewan River near the Riverdale area of Edmonton, Alberta.

Jewelry: Metal, Yellow, RING, With multiple clear stones and three yellow stones.
Metal, Yellow, RING, Has a clear stone
Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, NECKLACE, Religious medallion of the Madonna

Case reference: 2014001522.CaseDesc: On July 7, 1977, James Stackhouse and a friend were camped on a small island on the east shore of Lake Winnipeg, north of Hole River where they were doing some mapping. Their boat drifted away to the south towards Deer Island located 3 miles south. At approximately 6:00 p.m. both men left the shore holding onto some small logs that they had tied together with their belts. They attempted to swim to Deer Island but the current and the waves carried them to 1/4 mile east of Deer Island. The bundle of logs that they had tied broke and the men were separated. Mr. Stackhouse's friend managed to swim to Deer Island but he did not see Mr. Stackhouse again. Searches of the area were done by land, air and water but the body of Mr. Stackhouse was not recovered. He is presumed deceased due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014006235.CaseDesc: A lake freighter capsized in a violent storm on Lake Winnipeg, just north of Hecla Island, Manitoba. The vessel carried nine crew members and one passenger. There was only one survivor who managed to float on a piece of the wreckage to safety. All of the bodies of the remaining occupants were recovered with the exception of Allan Clemens and Tache Everett who were never located. Autopsies confirmed that the causes of death for those recovered were either drowning or death due to exposure in the cold water. Mr. Clemens and Mr. Everett are presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014004103.CaseDesc: Michelle Gurney was last seen in the downtown east side of Vancouver at the St. James Community Society building on December 11, 1998. She was reported missing ten days later. Ms. Gurney was engaged in a high risk lifestyle and had mental health issues.

Case reference: 2012020034.CaseDesc: The Edmonton Police Service is seeking assistance in locating Dylan Steven Koshman. He was last seen on October 12, 2008 on the south side of Edmonton.

Case reference: 2014006241.CaseDesc: On September 7, 2013, at approximately 10:00 a.m., Ranjit Singh was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Ranjit was visiting Toronto from India was scheduled to return on a 5:00 p.m. flight, but he never boarded the plane.

Case reference: 2014001137.CaseDesc: On April 20, 1974, the body of a middle aged man was found in Stanley Park in Vancouver, British Columbia. His appendix had been removed and he had lost all of his teeth during his life. He is believed to have died about three weeks earlier from an overdose of barbiturates.

Pants: Denim, Blue, Jeans, With wooden buttons
Jacket: Nylon, Navy blue with red lining

Case reference: 2014001088.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1973, the remains of an adult male were recovered from the Whirlpool of the Niagara River, in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 165lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His eye colour is believed to be brown. He was recovered without clothing.

Watch: Cloth, Left wrist, had a red, yellow and blue watchstrap.
Ring: Silver ring with a green stone on the third finger of his right hand

Case reference: 2020007348.CaseDesc: On April 25, 1971, Liliam Alvarado was seen for the last time as she left her hotel room in Toronto, Ontario. Liliam left the hotel without her belongings.

Case reference: 2013000135.CaseDesc: Harris Hill was last seen on November 10, 2010. He was going into the woods on Westbay Road near Parrsboro, N.S. to drop off apples at his deer stand. Mr. Hill failed to return home.

Case reference: 2018063453.CaseDesc: On August 14, 2003, at approximately 7:00 a.m., Senotta Thomas was seen for the last time as she left her residence in Toronto, Ontario. Senotta had left her home to go to work, but did not return home.

Case reference: 2014005826.CaseDesc: On June 4, 2012, the Banff RCMP were contacted by a tour company to report that Duc Dao and his son, Nguyen Dao of Vietnam did not arrive to board their bus at the scheduled time.  The two men had been staying at the Banff International Hotel and there were no personal items left in their room. The two men were due to fly back to Vietnam two days later. However, they did not board their scheduled flight and it is unknown if they returned to Vietnam.

Case reference: 2019052572.CaseDesc: On January 1, 1995, Bojan Stamenkovic was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Bojan was a mechanical engineer and a University of Toronto professor after he came to Canada from Serbia. At the time of his disappearance, he told his family that he would not be able to contact them for awhile due to unknown circumstances. Bojan has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2021006090.CaseDesc: At the end of July, 2019, Jonathan Fowler was seen for the last time in Picton, Ontario. Since then, there has not been any activity on his banking, phone and social media accounts. During the time of his disappearance, Jonathan was engaged in a high risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2018034298.CaseDesc: On June 16, 2018, Trevor Hamlyn was last seen at around 3:00 pm at his home in Paradise, Newfoundland and Labrador.  It is unknown what Trevor was wearing at the time.  Information received was that Trevor spent time in the woods with unknown individuals.

Case reference: 2014004556.CaseDesc: On January 18, 1981, at approximately 12:00pm, Donna Bester was last seen by her boyfriend in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, Donna was supposed to check into the North York General Hospital, but did not arrive and may have been despondent.

Case reference: 2016044292.CaseDesc: Chenel Dubé was last seen on August 10, 1970 in Montreal, Quebec. That evening, he called his mother to tell her that he would be home later. Chenel's vehicle was found 3 days later in the parking lot of a restaurant in Ville Saint-Laurent, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014005105.CaseDesc: On May 11, 2001, at approximately 8:00 p.m., Younes Taleb was seen for the last time at his mother’s business in Toronto, Ontario.

Mark: Cheek, Mole on the right cheek

Case reference: 2014001059.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1970, the body of a heavyset young adult male with black hair was found on the shore of Kamloops Lake in British Columbia. He had all his teeth removed during his life and had no noticeable scars or tattoos. He is believed to have drowned in the Thompson River near Riverside Park a few days earlier.

Shirt: Blue, Yellow, Corsair brand, checkered pattern
Blue, Longsleeve, Lancer Brand, Size Large, Blue with purple and black check pattern, longsleeve
White, Bluestone brand, long sleeves, size medium
Jacket: Nylon, Light Blue, Squall brand with hood, golfer label on front with zipper
Shoes: Brown, Oxfords, Vibram brand, made in Italy, with shoe laces

Case reference: 2014003060.CaseDesc: Pierre Lagacé was last seen on January 5, 2003. At the time, he was living in the Ville Lemoyne sector of Longueuil, Québec. Mr. Lagacé was reported missing by a family member. At the time of his disappearance, he had little money and no car in his name.

Case reference: 2007003699.CaseDesc: On April 9, 2007, a male was located in a forested area north of the intersection of Fiddlers Green Road and Glancaster Road in the community of Mount Hope, Hamilton. He is believed to have been deceased for 7 to 8 months and possibly longer.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, 2-3 inches in length
Teeth: Visible Missing, Upper teeth were lost or removed prior to death. Remaining teeth include 1 canine and 2 premolar teeth on each side of lower jaw
Shirt: Denim, Blue, "Kinswood" brand long sleeved button down shirt, size large
Money: $12.99 with one discolored coin, unknown denomination

Case reference: 2012020018.CaseDesc: Sahil Sharma has been missing from the Newton area of Surrey, B.C. since November 13, 2008.  On the day Sahil disappeared, he had attended to Kwantlen University in Surrey, B.C. to pay for his upcoming semester to study Information Technology.  Sahil did not have any known drug or alcohol addictions and no known mental health issues.  Sahil's disappearance is highly out of character and all avenues of investigation have not provided any information on his whereabouts.

Sweater: Grey, Red, Red stripes on the neck
Tattoo: Right Forearm, "RAM" written in Hindi symbols

Case reference: 2020008724.CaseDesc: On September 20, 1979, Irvin Lasinskas was last seen at the Wellesley Hospital in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Irvin was despondent.

Case reference: 2014004122.CaseDesc: Maria Evangelista was last seen on January 27, 1997, in Montreal. Maria had called her mother to tell her that she no longer wanted to return to the hospital and would like to work in California. Maria's luggage was found in a hotel, in San Francisco, on February 7, 1997.

Case reference: 2013000007.CaseDesc: Kimberly Ann McAndrew has been missing since August 12, 1989. At 4:20 p.m., she left the Canadian Tire where she was employed as a cashier. There were unconfirmed reports that Kimberly was last seen at the Gardenia Flower Shop in Penhorn Mall in Dartmouth. She was identified by an employee at the flower shop as having bought a balloon and a rose.

Shoes: Jade green, flat heeled slip on loafers

Case reference: 2014004301.CaseDesc: Zolton Zambory was reported missing by his estranged wife on January 24, 1965. On January 30, 1965, Vancouver City Police located his vehicle abandoned in Vancouver. His vehicle was unlocked with his personal belongings left behind. He emigrated from Germany and arrived in Quebec on May, 1957.

Case reference: 2014004807.CaseDesc: On October 28, 1988, Ronald Gerard Cole went missing. He has not been heard from by family or friends since then. He was a resident of Warren, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003618.CaseDesc: Maggie Mink was last in contact with her family in 1985; at the time, she indicated that she was moving to Vancouver from Manitoba. Ms. Mink was documented to be living in Vancouver's west end in 1987. There have been no further records of Ms. Mink since.

Case reference: 2005004199.CaseDesc: On June 11, 1999, this male was found in Lake Ontario, approximately 8 miles north of Port Weller. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 156 lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He had likely been in the water for weeks to months.

Teeth: Natural teeth with restorations of his upper and lower posterior teeth.

Case reference: 1993001330.CaseDesc: Darlene was last seen at home.
